title: Location-Based Problem Solving
text:
I am Gregorio Maya, a senior spatial data consultant currently based in Madrid, (Spain).
I am passionate about discovering the cues that drive behaviour in the built environment. With an MSc in Space Syntax and an honours Degree in Architecture, over the last 9 years in industry (urban consultancy, workplace strategy, and tech development) I have leveraged technical skills of data science to inform desing and policy based on data analysis and visualization.
More recently, I have been collaborating with open source projects with PySAL devs (Python Spatial Analysis Libraries).
Academic activities are also a complementary part of my professional development. I am a frequent (virtual) lecturer at Universidad de los Andes (COL) and I often collaborate with professors at UCA Carnterbury (UK) and Universidad Nacional del Litoral (ARG).

title: Greg Maya
text:
We shape spaces as much as they shape us. The routes we use, our preferred locations, what we see, and who we encounter not only create isolated experiences but also reinforce collective habits.
The design of our buildings and cities are, more often than not, based on hopes rather than post-occupancy studies. By surfacing information about the built environment, one can expect more human-center designs and create an information loop that constantly feeds spatial decision-making pipelines.

title: Services
text:
As a spatial data consultant, I mostly work with teams who want to take their data to the next level.
My approach is not to provide isolated solutions, but instead to walk the journey with you while making sure that the output is fit for purpose but also maintainable by you.
Most of what I focus on:

Urban diagnostics
Morphological metrics for scenario testing
Post-occupancy studies
Network modeling for spatial and social environments
Spatial visibility analysis
Interactive data visualization (spatial and not!)


Tools & Softwares
I use an array of tools depending on the needs. Yes, my preferance is usually to go open-source but this is not always possible. The following are just some tools I commonly use:
Python, PostGIS - SQL, Tableau, QGIS, Isovists, Gephi, to name a few…













Prop Tech
 Property technology companies are constantly trying to leverage their location information for augmented business insights. 










Real Estate Managers
 Managers need to create information pipelines to track and report space utilization for improving performance and community building. 










Architect Studios and Urban Planners
 Planners need analytics on land use, pedestrian movement, urban morphology, and more to create sustainable designs and policies based on evidence. 










Academia
 Network theories, morphological analysis or data analysis are not common practices for most social sciencies nowadays, but current market asks for profesionals aware of these domains. 










Data Vizualisation
 Most people and organisations need easy ways to visualize and understand their data. I can help to create data pipelines and dashboards for revealing important information.
